intro: Vincetoxicum lineare, commonly known as the narrowleaf snakeroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by orange or red berries. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
